title: Six Screen Plays by Robert Riskin
content:
Can anyone identify the typeface used for [Robert Riskin](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121105845/http:/www.amazon.com/gp/reader/0520205251/ref=sib_dp_pop_fc?ie=UTF8&p=S001#reader-link)?

Thanks,  
Dave

 [‹ help identifying??](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121105845/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50087 "Go to previous forum topic") [I need a similar font to this ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121105845/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50088 "Go to next forum topic")
author: pj76

comments.content:
“SIX SCREENPLAYS BY” is set in Michael Harvey’s [Ellington.](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121105845/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/ellington-mt/ellington-mt/)  
no idea about the other one. sorry.

The other is Folkwang by Hemann Schardt for Klingspor, 1949. Digitized by Phil’s Fonts as [Wicked](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121105845/http:/www.philsfonts.com/showing.html?sku=PF00002701P2&start=1).

Typophile comes through again. Thanks, Mike F!

Dave
